Technical specification

Source: vignettes/technical-specification.Rmd
technical-specification.Rmd

Input variables

All input files require these columns:

Column
SITE
WATERBODY
YEAR
NGR
EASTING
NORTHING

Physical model in file also requires:

Column Note
11 ALTITUDE
13 SLOPE
15 DISCHARGE One of DISCHARGE or VELOCITY
17 VELOCITY One of DISCHARGE or VELOCITY
19 DIST_FROM_SOURCE
21 MEAN_WIDTH
23 MEAN_DEPTH
25 BOULDER_COBBLES
26 PEBBLES_GRAVEL
27 SAND
28 SILT_CLAY
31 HARDNESS One of Alkalinity, Hardness, Conductivity or Calcium
32 CALCIUM One of Alkalinity, Hardness, Conductivity or Calcium
33 CONDUCTIVITY One of Alkalinity, Hardness, Conductivity or Calcium
36 ALKALINITY One of Alkalinity, Hardness, Conductivity or Calcium

GIS model requires:

Column
1 ALKALINITY
3 QCAT_CEH
4 %PEAT_CEH
5 CHALK_O1_CEH
6 CLAY_O1_CEH
7 HARDROCK_O1_CEH
8 LIMESTONE_O1_CEH
9 AREA_CEH
10 ALTBAR_CEH
11 ALT_CEH
12 DFS_CEH
13 SLOPE_CEH

To run a classification requires these biological observations:

Column
SPR_SEASON_ID
SPR_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (ABW,DISTFAM)
SPR_TL2_WHPT_NTAXA (ABW,DISTFAM)
SPR_NTAXA_BIAS
SUM_SEASON_ID
SUM_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (ABW,DISTFAM)
SUM_TL2_WHPT_NTAXA (ABW,DISTFAM)
SUM_NTAXA_BIAS
AUT_SEASON_ID
AUT_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (ABW,DISTFAM)
AUT_TL2_WHPT_NTAXA (ABW,DISTFAM)
AUT_NTAXA_BIAS

Any additional columns can be added if required for reference

Example physical input:

SITE Waterbody Year NGR Easting Northing Altitude Slope Discharge Velocity Dist_from_Source Mean_Width Mean_Depth Alkalinity Boulder_Cobbles Pebbles_Gravel Sand Silt_Clay Hardness Calcium Conductivity Spr_Season_ID Spr_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (AbW,DistFam) Spr_TL2_WHPT_NTaxa (AbW,DistFam) Spr_Ntaxa_Bias Sum_Season_ID Sum_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (AbW,DistFam) Sum_TL2_WHPT_NTaxa (AbW,DistFam) Sum_Ntaxa_Bias Aut_Season_ID Aut_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (AbW,DistFam) Aut_TL2_WHPT_NTaxa (AbW,DistFam) Aut_Ntaxa_Bias
MYR-GB-01-R Waterbody name 2016 SE 94200 91000 60 2.7 2 NA 10 6.4 21.7 101.4 58 36 3 1 NA NA NA 1 6.512 24 1.62 2 6.663 27 1.62 3 6.348 27 1.62

Example GIS input:

Test SiteCode SITE YEAR WATERBODY NGR EASTING NORTHING Alkalinity Qcat_CEH %peat_CEH chalk_O1_CEH clay_O1_CEH hardrock_O1_CEH limestone_O1_CEH Area_CEH AltBar_CEH Alt_CEH DFS_CEH Slope_CEH Spr_Season_ID Spr_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (AbW,DistFam) Spr_TL2_WHPT_NTaxa (AbW,DistFam) Spr_Ntaxa_Bias Sum_Season_ID Sum_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (AbW,DistFam) Sum_TL2_WHPT_NTaxa (AbW,DistFam) Sum_Ntaxa_Bias Aut_Season_ID Aut_TL2_WHPT_ASPT (AbW,DistFam) Aut_TL2_WHPT_NTaxa (AbW,DistFam) Aut_Ntaxa_Bias
TST-01-R 3101 2019 test SE 94200 91000 101.4 3 0 2.74263 13.4409 0 0 49.5875 175.5016 56 16.87714 2.573593 1 6.512 24 1.62 2 6.663 27 1.62 3 6.348 27 1.62

Validate observed values

The low level rict_validate function validates the input data. Returns list of dataframes containing fails, warnings and passing observed values. The validation rules adjust based on the model and area arguments. Here is a summary of checks:

  • Input â€˜dataâ€™ exists
  • Input is dataframe
  • Required columns are present
  • Columns have correct class
  • Conditional columns if present are correct class
  • Where multiple classes are allowed, convert columns to standardised class for example integer to numeric.
  • Suspected input errors are corrected for example 0 slope.
  • Additional columns/variables calculated for example mean temperate.
  • Logs failures and warnings applied using validation_rules table.
  • Replacements made to very low values for example
  • Returns dataframe with passing values, warnings, fails

Contents

  • Input variables
  • Validate observed values
